files.match_string:
var from = new RegExp('^\/keystone\/?$', 'i').test(req.url) ? '' : '?from=' + req.url;

		return res.redirect(keystone.get('signin url') + from);

var qs = querystring.stringify(req.query);

			return res.redirect(req.path + ((qs) ? '?' + qs : ''));

metadata.cwe: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
metadata.description: Untrusted user input in redirect() can result in Open Redirect vulnerability.

metadata.cwe: CWE-209: Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
metadata.description: Error messages with stack traces may expose sensitive information about the application.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: crypto.pseudoRandomBytes()/Math.random() is a cryptographically weak random number generator.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

metadata.cwe: CWE-807: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
metadata.description: User controlled data is used for application business logic decision making. This expose protected data or functionality.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: MD5 is a a weak hash which is known to have collision. Use a strong hashing function.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

metadata.cwe: CWE-943: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Data Query Logic
metadata.description: Untrusted user input in findOne() function can result in NoSQL Injection.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: SHA1 is a a weak hash which is known to have collision. Use a strong hashing function.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

		return s == '' || new RegExp(p).test(s);

metadata.description: Ensure that the regex used to compare with user supplied input is safe from regular expression denial of service.

metadata.cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
metadata.description: The Pug.js/Jade.js template has an unescaped variable. Untrusted user input passed to this variable results in Cross Site Scripting (XSS).
